word_mean: 目镜：显微镜(或望远镜)内的透镜或透镜系统，它距使用者的眼睛最近，可使物像更为放大

sentence.Network_en: Looking through the eyepiece you will see two black circles.
sentence.Network_cn: 透过目镜你可以看到两个黑色的圆环.

sentence.Network_en: Step 2 : Aim the eyepiece at the center of the primary mirror.
sentence.Network_cn: 把目镜中轴调整到主镜的中央.

sentence.Network_en: The star test is lightning - fast and requires only a good high - power eyepiece.
sentence.Network_cn: 光轴矫正是快速的并且要求需要高倍数的目镜.

entry.def: The eyepiece of a microscope or telescope is the piece of glass at one end, where you put your eye in order to look through the instrument.

means.word_mean: 1. combination of lenses at the viewing end of optical instruments

auth_sentence.content: When I looked into the eyepiece, I could see at least a hundred eggs, each no more than two millimetres wide.
auth_sentence.res_content: When I looked into the eyepiece, I could see at least a hundred eggs, each no more than two millimetres wide.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: When I looked into the eyepiece, I could see at least a hundred eggs, each no more than two millimetres wide.
